Questions.Question: What is the largest planet in our solar system?
Questions.Explanation: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system, known for its massive size and iconic Great Red Spot.

Questions.Question: Which planet is known as the 'Red Planet'?
Questions.Explanation: Mars is often referred to as the 'Red Planet' due to its reddish appearance caused by iron oxide on its surface.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the first satellite launched into space?
Questions.Explanation: Sputnik 1 was the first artificial satellite launched into space by the Soviet Union on October 4, 1957.

Questions.Question: Which space mission successfully landed humans on the Moon?
Questions.Explanation: Apollo 11 was the historic mission that landed the first humans, Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin, on the Moon on July 20, 1969.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the space telescope launched by NASA in 1990?
Questions.Explanation: The Hubble Space Telescope, launched in 1990, has provided breathtaking images and valuable scientific data about the universe.

Questions.Question: Which planet has the most moons in our solar system?
Questions.Explanation: Jupiter has the most moons in our solar system, with over 79 known moons orbiting around it.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the first satellite to orbit Mars?
Questions.Explanation: Mariner 9 was the first satellite to successfully orbit Mars, providing valuable data about the planet's surface and atmosphere.

Questions.Question: Which space mission sent the first woman into space?
Questions.Explanation: Vostok 6, launched by the Soviet Union, carried Valentina Tereshkova, the first woman to travel to space, on June 16, 1963.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the first space shuttle launched by NASA?
Questions.Explanation: Columbia was the first space shuttle launched by NASA on April 12, 1981, marking the beginning of the Space Shuttle program.

Questions.Question: Which planet is known for its beautiful rings?
Questions.Explanation: Saturn is famous for its stunning ring system, composed of ice particles, rocks, and dust, encircling the planet.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the first satellite to be launched into geostationary orbit?
Questions.Explanation: Syncom 3, launched by NASA in 1964, was the first satellite to achieve geostationary orbit, allowing continuous communication coverage.

Questions.Question: Which space mission sent the first American into space?
Questions.Explanation: Mercury-Redstone 3, also known as Freedom 7, carried Alan Shepard, the first American astronaut, into space on May 5, 1961.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the first satellite to be launched by the European Space Agency?
Questions.Explanation: Ariel 1, launched by the European Space Agency in 1962, was the first satellite operated by the agency.

Questions.Question: Which space mission sent the first human to orbit the Earth?
Questions.Explanation: Vostok 1, launched by the Soviet Union, carried Yuri Gagarin, the first human to orbit the Earth, on April 12, 1961.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the first satellite to be launched by Japan?
Questions.Explanation: Osumi, launched by Japan in 1970, was the first satellite to be successfully launched by the country.

Questions.Question: Which space mission sent the first American woman into space?
Questions.Explanation: STS-7, part of the Space Shuttle program, carried Sally Ride, the first American woman astronaut, into space on June 18, 1983.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the first satellite to be launched by China?
Questions.Explanation: Dong Fang Hong 1, launched by China in 1970, was the first satellite to be successfully launched by the country.

Questions.Question: Which space mission sent the first spacecraft to land on a comet?
Questions.Explanation: Rosetta, launched by the European Space Agency, successfully landed the Philae spacecraft on comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko in 2014.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the first satellite to be launched by India?
Questions.Explanation: Aryabhata, launched by India in 1975, was the first satellite to be successfully launched by the country.

Questions.Question: Which space mission sent the first human to walk on the Moon?
Questions.Explanation: Apollo 11, launched by NASA, allowed Neil Armstrong to become the first human to set foot on the Moon on July 20, 1969.
